page.title: 05Shops in N.E.Bolton
page.content: There are two main shopping areas - Bromley Cross and Harwood Precinct. There are twenty two shops at Bromley Cross and they are located on either side of a busy main road eg butcher's, newsagents and a video shop.The Co-Op supermarket was extended in 1982.The Post Office dispenses 2,350 pensions and allowances each week.Limited car parking space is a major problem. Harwood Precinct has nineteen shops,is traffic free and has a good car park.It was built twenty years ago and again caters mostly for everyday needs although there are also clothes shops and a sports shop. Shops are found strung out along the main roads at Bradshaw Brow and Longsight,but there are no shops on the new estates. Affetside has to rely on a mobile shop.
